required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Automated Analysis Algorithms in Second Trimester Obstetric Ultrasound
clinical_study.official_title: Automated Analysis Algorithms in Second Trimester Obstetric Ultrasound

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effect of the use of automated algorithms for the measurement of fetal biometry, and for the reconstruction of standard planes of fetal anatomy, compared with the standard ultrasound technique, during the second trimester ultrasound scan.

detailed_description.textblock:
In recent years in many ultrasound equipment were fitted with automated algorithms for measuring fetal biometry, and for the reconstruction of standard planes of fetal anatomy. Although there are studies that have assessed the application of these algorithms in terms of repeatability of the measurements made, or of possibility of acquiring diagnostic planes, there are no randomized controlled studies that evaluated their impact on the second trimester ultrasound scan.
The aim of the study is to evaluate the effect of the use of automated algorithms for the measurement of fetal biometry, and for the reconstruction of standard planes of fetal anatomy, compared with the standard ultrasound technique, in terms of:
- duration of the ultrasound scan
- quality of biometric measurements
- quality of the diagnostic planes
- operator satisfaction

primary_outcome.description: Duration of ultrasound examination in minutes

secondary_outcome.description: Score described by Salomon et al. 2006: range from 0 (worst) to 16 (best)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality score of fetal diagnostic planes
secondary_outcome.description: Score described by Salomon et al. 2008: range from 0 (worst) to 32 (best)

arm_group.description: Automated 3D techniques in measuring fetal biometry and reconstructing standard anatomical planes

intervention.description: Automated algorithms for measuring fetal biometry, and for the reconstruction of standard planes of fetal anatomy
Standard ultrasound examination without use of automated algorithms for measuring fetal biometry, and for the reconstruction of standard planes of fetal anatomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton pregnancy 19+0-21+6 weeks
- Live fetus
- No fetal abnormalities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple pregnancy
- Intrauterine fetal death
- Fetal abnormalities
